name: Mung Dal Fritters - Baked Moong Dal Pakoda
description: Mung Dal Fritters - Baked Moong Dal Pakoda. Petite yellow lentils (split and skinned mung beans) soaked and blended to a batter to make pakoda/Bhajji with onions and greens. Use red lentils or chickpea flour for variation. Vegan Gluten-free Recipe Makes about 16 to 18 fritters
recipeIngredient: 1  hot green chili  (or cayenne to taste 1/4 tsp)
1/2 to 1 tsp garam masala ( or curry powder)
1 1/2 cup lightly packed finely chopped spinach  (or rainbow chard loosely packed)

recipeInstructions.text: Soak the Mung dal in hot water for 15 minutes or 1 hour. Longer works best. Drain and add to blender. Add ginger, chili, garam masala, turmeric, salt, baking powder, oil and 1/4 cup water. Blend to a smooth thick batter. Add more water if needed. Keep the batter thick so it can hold its shape while baking. Thinner batter tends to flatten.
recipeInstructions.name: Soak the Mung dal in hot water for 15 minutes or 1 hour. Longer works best. Drain and add to blender. Add ginger, chili, garam masala, turmeric, salt, baking powder, oil and 1/4 cup water. Blend to a smooth thick batter. Add more water if needed. Keep the batter thick so it can hold its shape while baking. Thinner batter tends to flatten.

recipeInstructions.text: Pre-heat the oven to 425 degrees F / 220ºc.
recipeInstructions.name: Pre-heat the oven to 425 degrees F / 220ºc.

recipeInstructions.text: Add the chopped cilantro, greens, onion and garlic and fold in. Using a Tablespoon or ice cream scoop, drop spoonfuls of the batter on parchment lined baking sheet.
recipeInstructions.name: Add the chopped cilantro, greens, onion and garlic and fold in. Using a Tablespoon or ice cream scoop, drop spoonfuls of the batter on parchment lined baking sheet.

recipeInstructions.text: Lightly spray oil on top. Bake for 17 to 19 minutes until golden on the edges.
recipeInstructions.name: Lightly spray oil on top. Bake for 17 to 19 minutes until golden on the edges.

recipeInstructions.text: Add sprinkle of chaat masala on the fritters (optional). Serve with chutneys Mint Cilantro Chutney or tomato chutney or ketchup or add to kadhi (non dairy yogurt sauce) or curry.
recipeInstructions.name: Add sprinkle of chaat masala on the fritters (optional). Serve with chutneys Mint Cilantro Chutney or tomato chutney or ketchup or add to kadhi (non dairy yogurt sauce) or curry.
